item.title: 英国提供更多现金支持格兰杰茅斯炼油厂转型
item.description: 英国增加了对苏格兰格兰杰茅斯炼油厂向低碳未来转型的潜在财政支持。【原文：The UK has increased potential financial support for the transition of the Grangemouth oil refinery in Scotland to a low-carbon future.】

item.title: 南非采取行动限制不断攀升的医疗服务收费
item.description: 南非正在采取措施限制医疗费用，因为该国大多数人都负担不起不断上涨的医疗费用。【原文：South Africa is taking steps to cap health-care costs as it grapples with rising medical charges that most of the country can’t afford.】

item.title: 以色列将利率维持在 4.5%，等待通胀放缓
item.description: 以色列连续第九次会议维持利率不变，央行等待战争引发的通胀放缓后再启动宽松周期。【原文：Israel kept interest rates on hold for a ninth-straight meeting, with the central bank waiting for war-induced inflation to slow before starting an easing cycle.】

item.title: Hims & Hers 的 458% 涨幅因 FDA 削弱肥胖症销售而受到考验
item.description: Hims&Hers Health Inc.的迅猛涨势令备忘录股票交易者着迷，但这一涨势已经停止，这为这家远程医疗公司在周一收盘后公布财报时面临关键考验埋下了伏笔。【原文：The blistering rally in Hims & Hers Health Inc. that’s captivated meme-stock traders has ground to a halt, setting up a pivotal test when the telehealth company reports earnings after the market closes Monday.】

item.title: 蓝猫头鹰降低欧洲私人信贷早期投资者的费用
item.description: Blue Owl Capital 正在免除其一只基金的一大笔费用，以吸引欧洲投资者进入私人信贷领域。【原文：Blue Owl Capital is waiving a large chunk of fees on one of its funds to attract European investors into private credit.】

item.title: Robinhood 称美国证券交易委员会在未执法的情况下结束加密货币调查
item.description: Robinhood Markets 公司称，美国证券交易委员会结束了对该公司加密货币业务的调查，不会采取任何执法行动。【原文：Robinhood Markets Inc. said the US Securities and Exchange Commission closed an investigation into the firm’s cryptocurrency operations and isn’t pursuing any enforcement action.】

item.title: 安哥拉与西班牙BBVA银行据说正在商谈10亿美元贷款事宜
item.description: 据直接知情人士透露，西班牙毕尔巴鄂维斯卡亚阿根廷银行（Banco Bilbao Vizcaya Argentaria SA）正与安哥拉政府商谈提供多达10亿美元的贷款。【原文：Spanish lender Banco Bilbao Vizcaya Argentaria SA is in talks with Angola’s government to provide a loan of as much as $1 billion, according to people with direct knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 特斯拉准备在中国部署期待已久的 FSD 功能
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的人士透露，特斯拉公司正在为中国客户准备软件更新，以提供类似于美国市场上全自动驾驶的驾驶辅助功能。【原文：Tesla Inc. is readying a software update for customers in China to offer driver-assistance capabilities similar to those marketed as Full Self-Driving in the US, according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 南非因谷歌和 Meta 的反垄断行为对其进行处罚
item.description: 南非反垄断监督机构对包括 Alphabet 公司旗下谷歌和 Meta Platforms 公司旗下 Facebook 在内的科技公司的反竞争行为进行了处罚，称其损害了当地媒体公司的利益。【原文：South Africa’s antitrust watchdog penalized technology companies including Alphabet Inc.’s Google and Meta Platforms Inc.’s Facebook for anti-competitive practices it said hurt local media companies.】

item.title: 德国电力因风力减弱、气温降低的前景而上涨
item.description: 德国电力价格上涨，原因是风力发电量低于平均水平，而且预计本月下旬气温将更低，这可能导致在用电高峰期部署成本更高的化石燃料发电厂。【原文：German power prices rose with below-average wind generation and colder temperatures forecast for the turn of the month, which may lead to more costly fossil-fuel plants being deployed during peak electricity demand.】

item.title: 安东尼-莱万多夫斯基继续前进
item.description:
一项新协议有望使这家无人驾驶汽车先驱（后转为怀疑论者）成为自动驾驶卡车的最大运营商之一。【原文：

A new deal is poised to make the driverless-car pioneer (turned skeptic) one of the biggest operators of self-driving trucks.

】

item.title: 谷歌赢得Salesforce云服务交易，欲与微软抗衡
item.description:
这份价值 25 亿美元的合同标志着大型科技公司正在结成联盟，以提供更广泛的人工智能产品。【原文：

The contract, worth $2.5 billion, is emblematic of how big tech companies are forging alliances to offer a broader menu of AI products.

】

item.title: MongoDB 以 2.2 亿美元收购 Voyage AI，加强人工智能搜索
item.description: 数据库公司MongoDB公司表示，它将以2.2亿美元现金加股票的方式收购Voyage AI公司，以快速提升其帮助客户构建人工智能应用的能力。【原文：Database company MongoDB Inc. said it’s acquiring Voyage AI for $220 million in a cash-and-stock deal to fast-track its ability to help its customers build artificial intelligence-powered applications.】

item.title: 贸易威胁之后，加拿大人的经济情绪为 2020 年以来最差
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统的关税措施正在动摇美国最大贸易伙伴之一加拿大的消费者信心，65%的加拿大人表示，他们预计未来六个月经济将走弱。【原文：President Donald Trump’s tariffs are rattling consumer confidence in one of the US’s largest trading partners, with 65% of Canadians saying they expect the economy to weaken over the next six months.】

item.title: 雪佛龙公司对委内瑞拉经济至关重要，特朗普深知这一点
item.description: 委内瑞拉经济正从现代史上最严重的崩溃中缓慢复苏，其中一个重要原因是 2,200 英里之外的一家石油巨头：雪佛龙公司（Chevron Corp.【原文：One of the key reasons Venezuela’s economy is slowly recovering from the worst collapse in modern history is an oil giant 2,200 miles away: Chevron Corp.】

item.title: 默茨面临降低德国能源费用的艰巨任务
item.description:
在周日大选中获胜的保守党集团必须权衡降低成本与提高天然气依赖性的风险。【原文：

The conservative bloc that won Sunday’s election will have to weigh lowering costs against the risks of boosting dependency on gas.

】

item.title: 梅洛尼称阿拉伯联合酋长国将在意大利投资 400 亿美元
item.description: 在罗马接待阿联酋总统谢赫-穆罕默德-本-扎耶德-阿勒纳哈扬（Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan）访问意大利之后，意大利总理乔治亚-梅洛尼（Giorgia Meloni）表示，阿联酋将在意大利投资 400 亿美元。【原文：Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni said the United Arab Emirates will invest $40 billion in Italy after Rome hosted a visit of UAE President Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan.】

item.title: 墨西哥通胀率走高，与墨西哥银行预测一致
item.description: 2 月初，墨西哥年度通胀加速，与经济学家的预测基本一致，接近央行的预期，并保持了连续第六次降息的可能性。【原文：Mexico’s annual inflation accelerated roughly in line with economists’ forecasts in early February, holding near the central bank’s estimates and keeping chances of a sixth straight interest rate cut in play.】

item.title: 英特尔潜在解体引来投机性押注
item.description: 欢迎阅读 Tech In Depth，这是我们改版后的每日时事通讯，由彭博社全球记者提供有关科技商业的报道和分析。今天，英特尔（Intel）的命运成为焦点，伊恩-金（Ian King）审视了该公司利润下滑与股价上涨之间的分歧。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our revamped daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Intel’s fate is in the spotlight and Ian King looks at the divergence between the company’s slumping profit and rising share price.】

item.title: 美国与中国 "脱钩 "的鹰派言论是如何软化的？
item.description: 脱钩 "是过去十年来中美经济关系讨论中被提及最多的一个词。然而，在今天的华盛顿，你可以提出一个有力的论点，即世界上最大的两个经济体之间真正脱钩的可能性似乎远不如以前那么大了。【原文：Decoupling is the word that’s been thrown around most in discussions about the economic relationship between the US and China over the past decade. Yet in Washington today you can make a strong argument that an actual divorce between the world’s two largest economies seems far less likely than it once did.】

item.title: CME 瞄准散户交易者推出微型玉米和大豆合约
item.description: CME 集团希望为散户投资者提供一个交易玉米和大豆的机会；如果他们持有合约的时间过长，就不会有交割数千蒲式耳的风险。【原文：CME Group wants to give retail investors an opportunity to trade corn and soybeans — without the risk of taking delivery of thousands of bushels if they hang on to a contract for too long.】

item.title: 肯尼亚航空公司计划在 Covid 恢复后提升货运能力
item.description: 肯尼亚航空公司（Kenya Airways Plc）计划购置更大型的货机，以扩大非洲内部贸易，并使该地区的出口从科维德-19疫情的低迷中反弹。【原文：Kenya Airways Plc plans to acquire bigger cargo aircraft as intra-African trade expands and exports from the region bounce back from the Covid-19 pandemic slump.】

item.title: 供过于求，刚果暂停钴出口四个月
item.description: 刚果民主共和国表示，它将暂停钴出口四个月，以控制国际市场上电池金属的供过于求。【原文：The Democratic Republic of Congo says it’s suspending cobalt exports for four months to rein in oversupply of the battery metal on the international market.】

item.title: 五角大楼预算削减在即，Palantir高价收购多家公司成焦点
item.description: 上周 Palantir Technologies Inc. 股价的暴跌并没有让怀疑论者相信它突然变得便宜了。【原文：Last week’s rout in Palantir Technologies Inc. shares has done little to convince skeptics that it’s suddenly a bargain.】

item.title: 沙特政府准备发行绿色债券，债务狂潮仍在继续
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯政府授权银行进行新一轮的债务销售，包括首次发行绿色债券。【原文：Saudi Arabia’s government mandated banks for another wave of debt sales, including a debut green bond, as the kingdom ramps up a borrowing spree aimed at helping to fund the country’s vast economic diversification agenda.】

item.title: 工党称英国与美国举行了 "非常积极的 "贸易谈判
item.description: 英国商业和贸易大臣乔纳森-雷诺兹（Jonathan Reynolds）在印度举行的新闻发布会上表示，过去几天英国与美国就贸易问题进行了 "非常积极的对话"。【原文：The UK has held “very positive conversations” with the US over trade in the last few days, its Business and Trade Secretary Jonathan Reynolds said during a press conference in India.】

item.title: 软银、淡马锡等 eFishery 投资者几近全军覆没
item.description: 根据彭博新闻社（Bloomberg News）看到的文件，eFishery Pte.公司董事会聘请的调查人员已经确定，这家印尼初创公司的状况比他们之前想象的要糟糕得多，投资者每投入一美元，很可能只得到不到一美分的回报。【原文：Investigators hired by the board of eFishery Pte. have determined the Indonesian startup is in far worse shape than they previously thought, and that investors are likely to get back less than 10 cents for every dollar they invested, according to documents seen by Bloomberg News.】

item.title: 面对特朗普关税威胁，苹果将在美国增加 2 万个工作岗位
item.description: 苹果公司在寻求美国总统唐纳德-特朗普对从中国进口的商品征收关税的减免措施时表示，该公司将在美国新招2万名工人并生产人工智能服务器。【原文：Apple Inc., as it seeks relief from US President Donald Trump’s tariffs on goods imported from China, said that it will hire 20,000 new workers and produce AI servers in the US.】
